titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The Pembers went off to Oxford after breakfast: and we left soon afterwards. Colonel Darwin travelled with us as far as Doncaster. We arrived at N
17 Dean's Yard about 5 p.m. After tea I sate talking with mine host until dinner–time. M
Chamberlain, the widow of the late statesman, came to dine, a very pretty and charming woman. Also M

Chapin, the one silent & suppressed as ever, the other still a geyser of platitudes! If fertility in phrases could ever serve as a substitute for knowledge & thought, here were a wise woman indeed! After dinner I sate a–talking with Carnegie, until past 1 a.m., and then to bed.
